body_html:
regarding second or derivatives, i think we fixed bugs from 0.10 to 1.0 and in the nightlies; so definitely use that instead. keep in mind the following ops don't have second derivatives: tf.nn.sparse_softmax_cross_entropy_with_logits tf.nn.softmax_cross_entropy_with_logits so if you're using those for your loss, you'll have trouble. implement them yourself using tensorflow primitives and you'll be able to use second derivatives.
…

body_text:
regarding second or derivatives, i think we fixed bugs from 0.10 to 1.0 and
in the nightlies; so definitely use that instead.

keep in mind the following ops don't have second derivatives:

tf.nn.sparse_softmax_cross_entropy_with_logits
tf.nn.softmax_cross_entropy_with_logits

so if you're using those for your loss, you'll have trouble.  implement
them yourself using tensorflow primitives and you'll be able to use second
derivatives.
…

body:
regarding second or derivatives, i think we fixed bugs from 0.10 to 1.0 and
in the nightlies; so definitely use that instead.

keep in mind the following ops don't have second derivatives:

tf.nn.sparse_softmax_cross_entropy_with_logits
tf.nn.softmax_cross_entropy_with_logits

so if you're using those for your loss, you'll have trouble.  implement
them yourself using tensorflow primitives and you'll be able to use second
derivatives.

On Wed, Apr 5, 2017 at 10:09 AM, Ankesh Anand <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> Is it possible to compute second order derivatives with tf.nn.rnn if I
> switch to 0.10, or does it silently suppress any errors? cc @petrbel
> <https://github.com/petrbel> @vladfi1 <https://github.com/vladfi1>
> @ebrevdo <https://github.com/ebrevdo>
